A judge accepted a victim impact statement delivered by a virtual avatar of a deceased man during sentencing in a U.S. court. The twist? The AI forgave the defendant, yet the judge still handed down the maximum sentence. Linus and Luke dive into the implications, explore the growing use of generative AI in public spaces like Meta's new app and online matchmaking, and talk about whether universities, and even video games, are starting to crack under the pressure of AI’s rise.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t_JfQEr9PQ0

► GET EXCLUSIVE CONTENT ON FLOATPLANE: https://lmg.gg/lttfloatplane

title: Society isn't prepared for AI

Linus can’t believe Luke hasn’t watched the GTA 6 trailer, especially with how much hype it’s gotten. They talk about the wild level of detail Rockstar put in, how long the game has been in development, and why trailers like this are fair game for reaction content, even if YouTube’s copyright system doesn’t always agree.

Watch the full WAN Show: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=t_JfQEr9PQ0
